text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Romtelecom RA telephone untility increased tariffs for international calls.
- Razvan Temesan, ex-chairman of Bancorex SA foreign trade bank, says in interview his recent dismissal was unfair.
- Miners at the Crucea uranium mine threatened to launch a strike to protest against their low wages.
- The government approved credits worth 550 billion for seasonal farm works.
ADEVARUL
- The government decided to allot 100,000 tonnes of low-quality wheat to animal farms hit by shortage of fodder.
General:
ZIUA
- Romania's former king Michael had started a campaign to support his country's bid to get early admission in NATO.
- Former U.S. ambasador to Romania David Funderburk expected to arrive in Bucharest for a four-day visit.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Romania offered to take part in a peace-keeping mission to Albania.
- Eight Romnanians were evacuated from Tirana with help from the French embassy.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Bucharest city-hall started "crusade" against rats and mosquitos.
ADEVARUL
- The Senate's decision to lift parlamentary immunity of Greater Romania Party senator Vadim Tudor is final, Justice Minister Valeriu Stoica quoted as saying.
-- Bucharest newsroom 40-1 3120264
